comments.body: Yes just yes this is how you make a feedback lots of info about the mob and where it spawns.
YES!
We need this
Cool idea, check your spelling.
Thanks !
Good idea, I like how they would be hostile but I think they should have only a one block hive instead (like normal bees). The 'honey' could also be a regeneration potion.
Maybe a new mob for the Mountains Update?
Thanks for the votes yall
this could help with Egg farming.
That would definitely give forests even more life. How big would they be though? And what, if anything, would they drop?
What would the Beetles drop
Stag beetles are my favourite insect too they look so cool

I like this! They should definitely be large, like all minecraft bugs. I imagine they would drop their horns, which could be used in pvp as a high knockback, but low durability, item. It could also have some effect in potions, though I'm not sure what. They look like the kind of thing that would make cool magics.

I like this idea. After all, MOJANG needs to add more small details to our everyday biomes. These would a great addition to the Wild Update. I have a feeling they will be like llamas, neutral until provoked.
Check out my other enderman idea and please vote on it: good enderman
The should be able to become friendly and possibly build bridges over water
But there are some enderman theories that explain why they can only pick certain blocks. You should check them out
How About ender creepers. Black with purple eyes and mouth
How about another dragon that is actually the ender dragons mother .

How about endergrades,a type of tardigrade that roams the end and could be tamed using a chorus fruit,it's friendly. Ender Withers,an end version of the wither that's stronger and had more health,and enderlings,consisted of 3 hostile end mobs:Blastling,Watchling and Mutant Enderman/Enderscend. They're pretty aggressive too
I agree this would be a very nice feature to add to the game
Iron golems should be immune to arrows... THEY'RE IRON!
This could be the adult form of the Endermite. The enderhoney should be the same color as ender pearls
You should also be able to breed bats with pumpkin seeds to get a baby bat.
Speed up a baby bat's growth with pumpkin seeds.
Maybe this could be a nether dragon boss instead of a mega ender dragon
There could be but making use of the ender egg would be great
add a new skeleton to it, and a end zombie.
I like your idea but would be cool is if there was a way to tame this dire wolf.
It would be particularly awesome if you could turn your dog into a tamed version of this, but this sort of thing would have to be accompanied by an update for wolves in general.

Really good as a boss, even better as a tameable. Maybe we could have both? It would be unique in the sense that it’d be the only tameable boss in the game.

I feel like you should be able to spare it when it’s low on health and give it some bones to get a tamed dire wolf.
Fixed spelling in subject to make it easier to find.
That actually makes sense!
What if the kill spawned as a swarm like termites or bees so that they are easier to see and are more representative of there size.

Sir, given as it is in fact a video game, which does not contain gender of any sort beyond Steve and Alex... never mind. Anyway, I think if we are going to compare this to real life, compare it to the Tremblay’s Salamander. This artificially created breed of Salamander is an exclusively female species of Salamander that clones itself. However, to start the cloning process, it still needs to be courted by a male, the male essentially gets nothing out of it as his genes are not passed down. So, if we’re comparing Minecraft to real life, let’s just assume it works that way and we can all sleep at night! Good day!

Esto es demaciado esfuerzo solo para  nada
They should be able to tag all tamed animals on maps, like wolves and cats too
I agree with Crypto, maybe you could place a small banner on the collars of cats, dogs, and parrots.And you could attach a small banner onto the armor of a horse to show where they are on the map.
Or maybe just fix the pathway mechanics so they don't fall and die.

@Blast Burner I feel like just changing their fall damage would be simpler, plus I think it's kinda fun that the rabbits jump all over the place. Giving them less-erratic movement might just make them more boring
Also think they should start trusting llayers after a while
Giving Rabbits some form of Feather Falling by default would help solve the issue as well, making them resist damage from falls of up to 5 blocks in height would be very helpful!

I agree, it should probably have an AI
(Maybe be added to that giant biome that's pending?)
Yeah the Giant needs to have AI. hope they can bring it for 1.19. I could see this in the Deep Dark cities, just looming in one room.
You try taming a dolphin, they are smart enough to take advantage of the system, it's almost like trying to "tame" a person...

The extra drops and stuff are a cool idea, but I don't know about the wither lich.  I don't imagine the wither as a shapeshifting humanoid, more like a mysterious demon/beast, but the idea of a dangerous ending mechanic seems pretty cool.  Maybe it sprays wither skulls everywhere and goes crazy, or explodes or something.

I agree with cow pow, the lich idea is cool but far stretched, unlikely at best, in my opinion.
In bedrock edition, the wither does spawn some mobs to help it fight, and also has a charge attack where it flies horizontally, and breaks a bunch of blocks.
Regardless, these are some excellent ideas, and I think it will make boss fights much more interesting.
Mantis Shrimps did not live 400000000 years ago.
Their members did.
They did not.  There were no living creatures that long ago.
Their species branched off so that they could evolve.
If they did evolve, they evolved from a similar creature that survived the flood.
I really liked this idea. I am surprised nobody else voted for your idea.
Im sorry to bother you but Minecraft doesn't like hosile non fantasy mobs
Perhaps they could make it a neutral mob instead like wolves.

Me: I love this idea
Everyone else : EVOLUTION
